The Amaranth is thriving in the #BUGS garden. Quick facts: Amaranth originated in America and is one of the oldest food crops in the world, with evidence of its cultivation reaching back as far as 6700 BC. The genus Amaranth consists of nearly 60 species, several of which are cultivated as leaf vegetables, grains or ornamental plants, while others are weeds. Thank you to Ms. Laura for the photos and sharing her knowledge.
#BUGSgardens #sustainability #WeLovePlants

#BUGS in partnership with David Lynch Foundation is grateful that during these difficult times we can help our students practice stress reducing Transcendental Meditation techniques and become healthier, happier, and more focused.

Here's what 6th grade Imani shared with us "Since QT has been incorporated into my AM and PM schedule, I have found myself more focused to tackle my day in the mornings. Just when I feel overwhelmed I can rely on the PM for quiet time to reduce my anxiety and mellow out as I know that I am not alone when I see my other classmates in attendance. I also use it as a form of bonding with my family. My cousin and little brother who do not attend the school also take part in my quiet time and it makes my heart smile to know that they too are benefiting from my school's Quiet Time during the pandemic."
